EventDescription.Item: Incorrect connection (signal cable %1) between the Expansion board and the %2.
The Expansion board does not match the disk backplane.

EventSuggestion.Item: 1. Check for high temperature alarm of air inlet or outlet.@#AB;2. Check for fan alarms.@#AB;3. Check whether the air duct is installed.@#AB;4. Check whether the CPU heat sink or liquid cooling device is correctly installed.@#AB;5. Replace the CPU board.
1. Check for high temperature alarm of air inlet or outlet.@#AB;2. Check for fan alarms.@#AB;3. Check whether the air duct is installed.@#AB;4. Replace the CPU board.
1. Check for high temperature alarm of air inlet or outlet.@#AB;2. Check for fan alarms.@#AB;3. Check whether the air duct is installed.@#AB;4. Replace the CPU board.

1. Check for high temperature alarm of air inlet or outlet.@#AB;2. Check for fan alarms.@#AB;3. Check whether the air duct is installed.@#AB;4. Check whether the CPU heat sink or liquid cooling device is correctly installed.@#AB;5. Replace the CPU board.
1. Replace the CPU board.
1. Check whether all CPU models are the same.@#AB;2. Replace the CPU board.
1. Replace the CPU board.
1. Replace the CPU board.
1. Replace the CPU board.
1. Check the equipment room temperature.@#AB;2. Check for fan alarms.@#AB;3. Check for air inlet or outlet blockage.@#AB;4. If the problem persists, Replace the CPU board.
1. Check whether CPU is installed.@#AB;2. Replace the CPU board.

1. Perform maintenance according to the maintenance plan as soon as possible. Power off the server, and check whether the component and its slot are damaged or of poor contact.@#AB;2. Replace the component and check whether the fault is rectified.@#AB;3. Replace the CPU board.
Replace the CPU board.
Replace the CPU board.
Replace the CPU board.
Replace the CPU board.
Replace the CPU board.
Replace the CPU board.
Replace the CPU board.
Replace the CPU board.
1. Power off the server, and check whether the DIMM and its slot are damaged or of poor contact.@#AB;2. Replace the DIMM.@#AB;3. Replace the CPU board.
1. Install a DIMM into the alarmed slot.@#AB;2. Remove and reinstall the alarmed DIMM.@#AB;3. Replace the DIMM.@#AB;4. Replace the CPU board.

1. Locate the faulty DIMM based on the alarm information and replace the DIMM. When replacing the DIMM, ensure that the slot is clean and the new DIMM is not damaged.@#AB;2. If the fault still persists, replace the memory board indicated in the alarm information. If there is no memory board, Replace the CPU board holding the DIMM.@#AB;3. If the alarm information does not provide information about specific faulty DIMMs, channel problems may occur. Replace the memory board indicated in the alarm information. If there is no memory board, Replace the CPU board holding the DIMM.
1. Check whether the hard disk is properly inserted.@#AB;2. Replace the NVMe cable or SAS cable.@#AB;3. Replace the hard disk backplane or transfer card.@#AB;4. Replace the CPU board.
1. If there is a cable between the PSU backplane and the Expansion board, check whether the cable is disconnected or loose.@#AB;2. Remove and re-install the PSU.@#AB;3. Replace the PSU.
1. Reseat the RAID controller card.@#AB;2. Replace the RAID controller card.@#AB;3. Replace the Riser card.@#AB;4. Replace the CPU board.

1. Restart the iBMC.@#AB;2. Replace the component and check for alarms.@#AB;3. Replace the cables connecting the CPU board or the Expansion board.@#AB;4. Replace the CPU board.@#AB;5. Replace the Expansion board.
1. Restart the iBMC.@#AB;2. Remove and reconnect power cables or remove and reinstall the board in the chassis.@#AB;3. Replace the CPU board.
1. Restart the iBMC.@#AB;2. Remove and reconnect power cables or remove and reinstall the board in the chassis.@#AB;3. Replace the CPU board.

1. Check whether the front disk backplane is installed.@#AB;2. Check whether the signal cable of the front disk backplane is not connected or properly connected.@#AB;3. Check whether the power cable of the front disk backplane is not connected or properly connected.@#AB;4. Upgrade the CPLD of the front disk backplane.@#AB;5. Upgrade the Expansion board CPLD.@#AB;6. Replace the front-drive backplane.
Replace the BMC board.

1. Perform maintenance according to the maintenance plan as soon as possible. Power off the server, and check whether the component and its slot are damaged or of poor contact.@#AB;2. Replace the component and check whether the fault is rectified.@#AB;3. Replace the CPU board.
1. Power off the server and check whether there is damage or poor contact between the component and its slot.@#AB;2. Replace the CPU board.

1. Check whether the power supply meets server operation requirements.@#AB;2. Check for power cables that were disconnected or improperly connected to the PSUs before the alarm was generated.@#AB;3. Remove and reconnect power cables or remove and reinstall the board in the chassis.@#AB;4. Replace the PSU.@#AB;5. Replace the CPU board.

1. Check whether there are other alarms generated for the specified memory module. If yes, clear the alarms, and then check whether the alarm is cleared.@#AB;2. If there is no other memory alarm, check whether the DIMM models are compatible with the server and whether the DIMMs are installed properly.@#AB;3. Replace the DIMMs.@#AB;4. Replace the CPU board.
Replace the Disk backplane.

1. Check whether there are other alarms generated for the specified memory module. If yes, clear the alarms, and then check whether the alarm is cleared.@#AB;2. If there is no other memory alarm, check whether the DIMM models are compatible with the server and whether the DIMMs are installed properly.@#AB;3. Replace the DIMM.@#AB;4. Replace the CPU board.

EventCause.Item: 1. The CPU is faulty.@#AB;2. The CPU board is faulty.
1. The server is configured with different models of CPUs.@#AB;2. A CPU is faulty.@#AB;3. The CPU board is faulty.
1. The CPU is faulty.@#AB;2. The CPU board is faulty.
1. No CPU is installed.@#AB;2. The CPU socket is in poor contact with the CPU.@#AB;3. The CPU board is faulty.
The CPU board is faulty.
The CPU board is faulty.
The CPU board is faulty.
The CPU board is faulty.
The CPU board is faulty.
The CPU board is faulty.
The CPU board is faulty.
The CPU board is faulty.
1. The connection of memory is loose or faulty.@#AB;2. The Memory is faulty.@#AB;3. The CPU board is faulty.
1. The memory module is faulty.@#AB;2. The slot of the memory module on the CPU board is faulty.
1. The fan module is removed.@#AB;2. The fan module is in poor contact with the fan backplane.
1. The PCIe card is faulty.@#AB;2. The CPU board is faulty.
1. The RAID controller card is faulty.@#AB;2. The CPU board is faulty.
1. The NIC is faulty.@#AB;2. The CPU board or Expansion board is faulty.

1. The front-drive backplane is not installed.@#AB;2. The signal cable of the front disk backplane is not securely connected.@#AB;3. The power cable to the front disk backplane is not securely connected.@#AB;4. The CPLD of the front disk backplane is faulty.@#AB;5. The Expansion board CPLD is faulty.@#AB;6. The front disk backplane is faulty.
The signal cable between the CPU board and the device is not properly connected.
1. The CPU is faulty.@#AB;2. The CPU board is faulty.
1.The component has a voltage dip or is faulty.@#AB;2. The power supply is abnormal.@#AB;3. The PSU is abnormal.
1. The mains supply does not meet the power consumption requirements of the entire server.@#AB;2. The component is faulty.
The Expansion board does not match the drive backplane.
1. The OCP card is faulty.@#AB;2. The Expansion board is faulty.

EventDescription.Item: 扩展板与%2的信号线%1连接异常。
扩展板与硬盘背板不匹配。

EventSuggestion.Item: 1、检查服务器是否同时存在进风口/出风口高温告警。@#AB;2、检查服务器是否同时存在风扇告警。@#AB;3、检查服务器是否已安装导风罩。@#AB;4、检查是否正确安装CPU散热器或液冷装置。@#AB;5、更换CPU板。
1、检查服务器是否同时存在进风口/出风口高温告警。@#AB;2、检查服务器是否同时存在风扇告警。@#AB;3、检查服务器是否已安装导风罩。@#AB;4、更换CPU板。
1、检查服务器是否同时存在进风口/出风口高温告警。@#AB;2、检查服务器是否同时存在风扇告警。@#AB;3、检查服务器是否已安装导风罩。@#AB;4、更换CPU板。
1、检查服务器是否同时存在进风口/出风口高温告警。@#AB;2、检查服务器是否同时存在风扇告警。@#AB;3、检查服务器是否已安装导风罩。@#AB;4、检查是否正确安装CPU散热器或液冷装置。@#AB;5、更换CPU板。
1、更换CPU板。
1、检查CPU型号是否一致。@#AB;2、更换CPU板。
1、更换CPU板。
1、更换CPU板。
1、更换CPU板。
1、检查机房环境温度是否已超出服务器设备运行环境要求。@#AB;2、检查服务器是否同时存在风扇告警。@#AB;3、检查服务器进风口/出风口是否有异物堵塞。@#AB;4、如果以上三步仍然不能解决问题，更换CPU板。
1、检测CPU是否在位。@#AB;2、更换CPU板。
1、尽快安排计划性维护，下电后检查该部件与其插槽是否存在损坏或接触不良现象。@#AB;2、更换该部件并进一步观察。@#AB;3、更换CPU板。
更换CPU板。
更换CPU板。
更换CPU板。
更换CPU板。
更换CPU板。
更换CPU板。
更换CPU板。
更换CPU板。
1、下电后检查内存与其插槽是否存在损坏或接触不良现象。@#AB;2、更换内存。@#AB;3、更换CPU板。
1、在告警的内存槽位安装内存。@#AB;2、重新拔插告警内存。@#AB;3、更换内存。@#AB;4、更换CPU板。

1、对于告警信息中指定了具体故障内存条的，请优先更换报错内存条，同时确保更换的内存条不存在物理损伤，且报错内存条所在槽位不存在脏污，异物等情况。@#AB;2、若更换内存条后仍然出现相同的错误，如告警信息中有指定内存板，则请优先更换报错的内存板，如系统不存在内存板，则直接更换出错内存条所在的CPU板。@#AB;3、对于告警信息中没有指定具体故障内存条的，属于Channel故障，如告警信息中有指定内存板，则请优先更换报错的内存板，如系统不存在内存板，则直接更换报错内存条所在的CPU板。
1、检查硬盘是否插好。@#AB;2、更换NVMe线缆或者SAS线缆。@#AB;3、更换硬盘背板或转接卡。@#AB;4、更换CPU板。@#AB;5、更换扩展板。
1、如果电源背板与扩展板之间有线缆，检查线缆是否未插或松动。@#AB;2、重新拔插电源。@#AB;3、更换电源。
1、插拔RAID卡。@#AB;2、更换RAID卡。@#AB;3、更换Riser卡。@#AB;4、更换CPU板。
1、重启iBMC。@#AB;2、更换该部件并进一步观察。@#AB;3、更换CPU板或扩展板上的线缆。@#AB;3、更换CPU板。
1、重启iBMC。@#AB;2、拔插电源线缆或拔插单板。@#AB;3、更换CPU板。
1、重启iBMC。@#AB;2、拔插电源线缆或拔插单板。@#AB;3、更换CPU板。
1、检查前置硬盘背板是否已安装。@#AB;2、检查前置硬盘背板信号线缆是否未插或者松动。@#AB;3、检查前置硬盘背板电源线缆是否未插或者松动。@#AB;4、升级前置硬盘背板CPLD。@#AB;5、升级扩展板CPLD。@#AB;6、更换前置硬盘背板。
更换BMC插卡。
1、尽快安排计划性维护，下电后检查该部件与其插槽是否存在损坏或接触不良现象。@#AB;2、更换该部件并进一步观察。@#AB;3、更换CPU板。
1、下电后检查该部件与其插槽是否存在损坏或接触不良现象。@#AB;2、更换CPU板。
1、检查外部供电是否满足服务器整机功耗要求。@#AB;2、确认告警发生时所有电源的输入线缆是否松动。@#AB;3、拔插电源线缆或在机框内拔插单板。@#AB;4、更换电源。@#AB;5、更换CPU板。
1、检查系统有没有其它指定内存条的告警信息，如果有请先按照其他告警对应的处理措施消除告警后再启动看此告警是否消除。@#AB;2、若没有其他内存相关告警，请检查内存型号及插法情况符合要求。@#AB;3、更换内存。@#AB;4、更换CPU板。
更换CPU板。
1、检查系统有没有其它指定内存条的告警信息，如果有请先按照其他告警对应的处理措施消除告警后再启动看此告警是否消除。@#AB;2、若没有其他内存相关告警，请检查内存型号及插法情况符合要求。@#AB;3、更换内存。@#AB;4、更换CPU板。

EventCause.Item: 1、CPU故障。@#AB;2、CPU板故障。
1、在位的CPU类型不一致。@#AB;2、CPU故障。@#AB;3、CPU板故障。
1、CPU故障。@#AB;2、CPU板故障。
CPU板故障。
CPU板故障。

CPU板故障。
CPU板故障。
CPU板故障。
CPU板故障。
CPU板故障。
1、内存连接松动或损坏。@#AB;2、内存故障。@#AB;3、CPU板故障。
1、内存故障。@#AB;2、CPU板内存条槽位故障。
1、风扇模块被拔出。@#AB;2、风扇模块与风扇板接触不良。
1、PCIe卡故障。@#AB;2、CPU板故障
1、RAID卡故障。@#AB;2、CPU板故障。
1、网卡故障。@#AB;2、CPU板或者扩展板故障。
1、前置硬盘背板未安装。@#AB;2、前置硬盘背板信号线未插稳。@#AB;3、前置硬盘背板电源线未插稳。@#AB;4、前置硬盘背板CPLD故障。@#AB;5、扩展板CPLD故障。@#AB;6、前置硬盘背板故障。
CPU板与此设备的信号线连接异常。
1、CPU故障。@#AB;2、CPU板故障。
1、组件有电压跌落或组件故障。@#AB;2、外部供电异常。@#AB;3、电源异常。
1、外部供电不满足服务器整机的功耗要求。@#AB;2、组件故障。
扩展板与硬盘背板型号不匹配。
1、OCP卡故障。@#AB;2、扩展板故障
